clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: An adjuvant therapy used for acute and chronic myelonous leukemia lung cancer and nasopharyngeal cancer It is also used to treat hypercholesterolaemia

incompatibilities.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Picosulfuric acid can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex
The therapeutic efficacy of BCG vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex
The therapeutic efficacy of Typhoid vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Dicoumarol
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Phenindione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Warfarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Phenprocoumon
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Acenocoumarol
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with 4 hydroxycoumarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Coumarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with R warfarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Ethyl biscoumacetate
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Fluindione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Clorindione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Diphenadione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Tioclomarol
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with S Warfarin
The therapeutic efficacy of Lactulose can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex
The therapeutic efficacy of Vibrio cholerae CVD 103 HgR strain live antigen can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex
